Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: *critical (adj.) having the potential to become disastrous*   I don’t think that’s a term with a particular medical definition (?) The health effects of low body weight are also pretty variable in terms of onset and severity. People lose bone density at various points, experience cardiac function issues at various points, and die at various points.   I‘d guess your friend wasn’t really thinking of BMI or bradycardia in his word choice. I’d guess he was saying he doesn’t want to lose you. <3

Author: DesperateLyingFox
Text: i would say when youre starting to see the health problems... Like, there are healthy underweight people, BMI is indeed not very accurate for an Individual, but ED people try to go lower than that in unhealthy ways which you can often se in hairloss, broken nails, unhealthy looking skin and so on... ☹️
